title: How to Make a Lime Tart

steps.headline: Finely grind the graham crackers in a food processor.
Add the melted butter and the 2 tablespoons of sugar to the graham crackers.
steps.description: Process them until everything is thoroughly blended.

steps.headline: Spoon the mixture into a 9-inch tart pan.
steps.description: If you don't have a tart pan, any similar size baking pan will do.

steps.headline: Press the graham cracker crust into the pan.
steps.description: Use a glass or something similarly to smooth and evenly distribute the crust. You want it fairly well compacted.

steps.headline: Bake the crust in the oven for about 10 minutes.
steps.description: You want it to be fragrant and slightly browned, but not over done. You will be baking the crust again with the tart filling.

steps.headline: Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool.
Stir together the 1/2 cup sugar and the milk in a medium sized bowl.
Add the eggs and whisk them with the lime mixture.
Add a pinch of salt (optional).
steps.description: Salt is said to enhance the flavor of the lime.

steps.headline: Remove the air bubbles from the mixture.
steps.description: Bang on the bowl a bit (or drop it from about a half inch above your working surface) to get all of the bubbles out of it.

steps.headline: Pour the lime mixture into your crust.
Put the tart in the oven until it sets.
steps.description: This will take approximately 20 to 25 minutes, depending on your oven.

steps.headline: Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool completely.
Put the tart in the refrigerator to chill.
steps.description: Be sure that to chill it for at least two hours.

steps.headline: When serving, garnish (if desired).
steps.description:
Some suggestions:

Grate lime zest over it. Make a meringue with the left over egg whites. Top the tart with the meringue.

Making the Crust Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/30\/Make-a-Lime-Tart-Step-1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/30\/Make-a-Lime-Tart-Step-1.jpg\/v4-170px-Make-a-Lime-Tart-Step-1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344,"bigWidth":"170","bigHeight":"127","licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Finely grind the graham crackers in a food processor. Add the melted butter and the 2 tablespoons of sugar to the graham crackers. Process them until everything is thoroughly blended. Spoon the mixture into a 9-inch tart pan. If you don't have a tart pan, any similar size baking pan will do. Press the graham cracker crust into the pan. Use a glass or something similarly to smooth and evenly distribute the crust. You want it fairly well compacted. Bake the crust in the oven for about 10 minutes. You want it to be fragrant and slightly browned, but not over done. You will be baking the crust again with the tart filling. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool. Making the Tart Stir together the 1/2 cup sugar and the milk in a medium sized bowl. Stir in the lime juice. Add the eggs and whisk them with the lime mixture. Add a pinch of salt (optional). Salt is said to enhance the flavor of the lime. Remove the air bubbles from the mixture. Bang on the bowl a bit (or drop it from about a half inch above your working surface) to get all of the bubbles out of it. Pour the lime mixture into your crust. Put the tart in the oven until it sets. This will take approximately 20 to 25 minutes, depending on your oven. Remove the tart from the oven and let it cool completely. Put the tart in the refrigerator to chill. Be sure that to chill it for at least two hours. When serving, garnish (if desired). Some suggestions: Grate lime zest over it. Make a meringue with the left over egg whites. Top the tart with the meringue.
